Ke'aki Technologies, LLC,  headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaii, is a Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO) owned business. A premier government services company, Ke'aki Technologies offers a full spectrum of solutions that improve the performance and operational effectiveness of our government and Department of Defense customers. Our mission synchronized solutions are designed to deliver exactly what our customers need, when they need it. From base and range operations to biomedical defense support to telecommunications and IT services, we deliver the exact talent, tools and technologies needed to meet mission requirements.  
  
Ke'aki Technologies has an exciting opportunity for a Financial Data Analyst. The position will be located in at the Pacific Missile Range Facility (PMRF), Kekaha, HI.  
  
The Financial Data Analyst performs financial data analysis for the purpose of reconciling Manu Kai costs with Government's BIS accounting system in conformance with company and Governmental accounting principles, policies and objectives.  
  
DUTIES INCLUDE:  
Primary areas of responsibility include in-depth analysis of financial transactions and transaction line item reconciliation between multiple Manu Kai source systems, Deltek CostPoint and the government's Business Information System (BIS).  
Determines and audits account designations and distributes charges and credits in association with data reconciliation.  
Prepares and audits financial records for reconciliation and final close outs.  
Assist in developing, updating and/or revising company accounting processes, controls and procedures relating to reconciliations and close outs to ensure all contractual requirements are met.  
Assist in developing and implementing financial controls and procedures to meet corporate and government compliances standards relating to reconciliations.  
Prepares and analyzes financial status reports and recommends solutions on problem areas.  
Prepares, reviews and submits Contract Data Requirements in a timely manner.  
Coordinate with various departments on the project including Finance, Contracts, Purchasing, Supply/Logistics and Public Works in order to research and verify cost data accuracy.  
Research and identify systems errors to assist in reconciliation efforts.  
Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor/Manager.  
  
WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES:  
Physical Activities:  
  
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  
Education:  
Experience:  
Must be capable of operating personal computers, computer software and/or accounting systems and standard office equipment.  
Must be knowledgeable in spreadsheet software and word processing programs.  Two years working knowledge of MS Office.  Advance Excel skills to include pivot tables, array formulas, vlookup formulas, etc.  
Must possess working understanding of performing efficient reconciliation of the database using mutually exclusive data subsets.  
Must possess the ability to research and identify transactions in error and made correcting entries to ensure data accuracy.  
  
SECRET CLEARANCE:   None Required
